competitors.name: Adidas
competitors.market_position: Nike’s biggest competitor; global sportswear giant with strong presence in athletic footwear and apparel targeting similar demographics including Gen Z.

competitors.name: Anta
competitors.market_position: Leading Chinese sportswear brand; significant competitor in China’s market where Nike faces growth challenges; increasingly targeting younger consumers.

competitors.name: Li-Ning
competitors.market_position: Another major Chinese brand competing with Nike in China’s sportswear industry; appealing to younger audiences with localized strategies.

competitors.name: Asics
competitors.market_position: International sportswear company competing in athletic footwear and apparel; recognized as a Nike competitor.

competitors.name: Puma
competitors.market_position: Global sportswear brand competing in footwear and fashion segments relevant to Nike’s market.

competitors.name: Under Armour
competitors.market_position: International sportswear brand competing in performance apparel and footwear; a recognized competitor to Nike.

competitors.name: Fila
competitors.market_position: Sportswear brand competing in footwear and apparel segments globally, including India and other emerging markets.

competitors.name: New Balance
competitors.market_position: Well-known athletic footwear brand competing with Nike in running and casual sneaker segments.

competitors.name: Skechers
competitors.market_position: Global footwear brand competing in casual and athletic footwear; considered a competitor to Nike in similar consumer segments.

competitors.name: Lululemon
competitors.market_position: Primarily an athletic apparel brand competing in premium athleisure and yoga wear markets.

competitors.name: Athletica
competitors.market_position: Competes with Nike in athletic apparel category but less established internationally.

competitors.name: VF Corporation
competitors.market_position: Parent company to several apparel brands; competes in athletic wear and lifestyle segments.
